713117f-a.text:
0ld brownstone houses, 528-530-532-534 West 42nd Street, south side, between Tenth and Eleventh Avenues. Nos. 528-530 contain the offices of V. Loewer's Brewery, which is on 41st Street, and an
entrance for trucks.
May 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

710566f-a.text:
Tenth Ave., at the N.W. corner of West 42nd Street. Also shown is the north side of West 42nd Street, west from Tenth Ave.
February 5, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

713118f-a.text:
566-528 West 42nd Street, south side, from Eleventh Avenue towards Tenth Avenue.
February 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

713115f-a.text:
42nd Street, north side, west from and including Tenth Avenue.
February 5, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

713116f-a.text:
West 42nd Street, south side, east from (No. 528, 3 story building, a portion of Loewer's Brewery office) a point between Eleventh and Tenth Avenues, and to the latter (left), showing a demolition for the new Railroad cut of the New Yoork Central under way. The 4 story kindergarten on the right will be included.
March 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr

713114f-b.text:
(1)
42nd Street, south side, west from and including Tenth Avenue, showing the demolition of 508 and 510-512 West 42nd, built and owned by the New York Fireproof Tenement Company. Nos. 500-502, and half of 506-508, are left standing.
March 20, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same.
May 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

713114f-a.text:
(1)
42nd Street, south side, west from and including Tenth Avenue, showing the demolition of 508 and 510-512 West 42nd, built and owned by the New York Fireproof Tenement Company. Nos. 500-502, and half of 506-508, are left standing.

713122f-a.text:
West 42nd Street, north side, west from, but not including Tenth, to, but not including Eleventh Aves. Plot fenced in is a portion of excavation work necessary for the new railroad right of way. Part of a statewide program eliminating grade crossings, it also relates to the City West Side Improvement plan.
May 21, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
